Create raised garden beds: If the ground is too hard to dig into, you can create raised garden beds. This involves building a frame out of wood or other materials and filling it with soil that is easier to work with. This way, you can plant your garden without having to dig into the hard ground.

Use hydroponics: Another option is to use hydroponics to grow your garden. This method involves growing plants in a controlled environment without soil. You can use a hydroponic system to grow a variety of plants, including vegetables, fruits, and herbs.

Plant container gardens: Container gardens are a great option if the ground is too hard to dig into. You can use pots, planters, or other containers to grow your plants. This way, you can control the soil and the environment in which your plants grow.

Use a garden fork: If the ground is too hard to dig into, you can use a garden fork to loosen the soil. This tool is designed to break up hard soil and make it easier to work with. You can use a garden fork to create small holes in the ground where you can plant your plants.

Use a tiller: A tiller is a powerful tool that can help you break up hard soil. It works by rotating a blade through the soil, breaking it up and turning it over. This can make it easier to work with the soil and plant your garden. However, tillers can be heavy and difficult to use, so they may not be the best option for everyone.
